Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of ANP-HA-GNPs for Chemoresistant Retinoblastoma

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted using an in ovo chicken chorioallantoic membrane model and an orthotopic in vivo RB rat eye model.

Intervention.evidence: Etoposide-resistant RB cells were treated with ANP-HA-GNPs, with phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) serving as the control.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the potential of atrial natriuretic peptide-conjugated hyaluronic acid-coated gold nanoparticles (ANP-HA-GNPs) as an adjuvant treatment for chemoresistant RB.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was tumor growth reduction, assessed over a 7-day period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed with sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to treatment allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 60 eggs were randomised: 30 to the ANP-HA-GNPs group and 30 to the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: ANP-HA-GNPs significantly reduced tumor growth and angiogenesis compared to controls (mean difference = 2.5 mm, 95% CI 1.8 to 3.2; p < 0.001).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group, indicating a favorable safety profile.

Funding.evidence: The study was supported by institutional grants.
